page.title: 04Holmes and surrounding area.
page.content: The area of Holmes is quite flat and good for riding your bicycles. Which ever way you look you see big open fields which always seem to be green or greenhouses. The highest part is only about 12 metres above sea level and the hamlet itself is about 6 or 7 metres above sea level. In Holmes it is quiet but it is all to do with what time of year it is. If it is Winter it is very quiet because crops are not being grown. If it is Summer then everbody is busy because crops are ready to go to market. If it is Spring or Autumn it is alright but it is still a bit busy. In Spring people are planting and sowing corn , potatoes , onions and other vegetables. In Autum they are busy harvesting the crops. You will see more tractors than other vehicles.
